title: Victor Lindelof addresses Ole Gunnar Solskjaer sack speculation ahead of Man Utd vs Liverpool
text:

Victor Lindelof reckons there is "probably no danger" to Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer despite rumours he could be sacked.

The Red Devils have endured a rocky start to the season, their worst in 30 years, and currently sit 12th in the Premier League - two points above the relegation zone and 15 points adrift of table toppers Liverpool .

They were condemned to a shock defeat to Newcastle before the international break, their third league loss of the season, to leave Solskjaer's position in the Old Trafford dugout looking shaky with a tricky clash with the Reds on Sunday.

But centre back Lindelof has backed the Norwegian and praised him for his role as a coach.

“He's very good,” Lindelof told Swedish outlet Expressen .

(Image: Manchester United via Getty Imag)

“A coach that is easy to talk to and discuss with and who has a good balance when he should be tough and when he should not be tough.

“Since then he has been in the club himself as a player and knows what it takes to succeed there and he has a lot of control.

“You are used to criticism. When you are in United, everything gets much bigger. There are more people watching, more people writing about the club than any other club.

(Image: REUTERS)

(Image: EMPICS Sport)

“For him it is probably nothing new, he himself has been a player there, then things went a little better for the club, but he knows exactly what it takes to be a player and how much pressure there is on us.

“There is probably no danger to him.”

Rio Ferdinand also thinks United will hold off the trigger for the foreseeable future.

"There's no way the club would have thought this would be rosy straight away, they're not naive enough to think that it was going to be a situation where he just changes it overnight," the United legend told talkSPORT.

"This is definitely something where there is going to be early pain, there is going to be a situation where the results are not going to go our way, especially with the new recruitment that they've started to go with younger players.

"That's why I don't see there being a change straight away, I'd be very surprised if I wake up, open a paper or an app and see that he has gone so quickly."
description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's reign as Man Utd boss has been rumoured to be coming to a close but Victor Lindelof has had his say
